text: Draft. A golden beer with an off-white head. The aroma has notes of fruit, caramel, and bread. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, bread, and caramel, leading to a dry finish.
CBC2015, Pours orange with a beige head, aroma of yeast, lactic, labaneh, flavor of goat cheese, lactic, medium bodied

Sample @ Charleston Brewvival 2015. Amber pour with a small head. Nose is a bit funky. Some woody. Fig and strawberry. Leather. Yeasty. Similar flavor. Sweet and a bit wild. Toffee and dark fruits. Earth. Light lemon zest. Medium body, active carb. Interesting stuff. All over the place, but still tasty.
On tap at CBC 2015. Pours a hazy light amber. Sweet with a light bitterness. Citric hops aromas with hints of barnyard. Also aromas of cask wood. Medium to full bodied. Long bitter finish.

Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours tiny hazy golden with a small offwhite head that leaves some small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly malty and slightly funky with bread, caramel, lemon juice, hay, dry soil, leather, barnyard and lemon zest. Taste is sweet, sour, malty and slightly funky. Mouthfeel is round, tart, tiny dry and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and sour with buttered dark bread, caramel, biscuits, lemon juice, grapes, hay, dry soil, leather, banryard and lemon zest. Decent but a bit too buttery.

On tap at CBC15. Deep reddish amber with off white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, tropical fruit, caramel, light tart, light acetic and some bready toffee notes. Taste is fruity, sweet, acetic, slight lactic, dark fruit and caramel.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ (blue session). Amber colour, small white head. aroma is fruity, floral, some wooden and mildly herbal notes. Flavour is fruity, wooden, some tobacco and mild toffeeish notes.

May 1, 2015. On tap at CBC, Blue session. 
Dark amber with a small creamy off-white head. Aroma is sweet malt and berries with toffee, raspberries, hints of banana, some spicy yeasty notes, earthy and citrus. Taste is smooth, ligth ot medium sweet, soft bitter, hints of berry and citrus tartness.
FInish is sweet berries and toffee, light earthy, herbal notes and hints of citrus.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation. 
Quite good and easy drinkable.

Very good malty, biscuity, wood(?). Good shit. ---Rated via BeerBuddy for iPhone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light purpley reddish, light tan head. Sweet vinous, lightly tart raspberry. Slightest bit of earthy spice. Some oak. Pleasantly tart, sweet. Finishes substantially more dry, longish, clean. Medium body. Very good.

Aroma is sweet, tropical fruit, turns to vinegar and sour. Appearance is dark rust, off white head. Taste is fruity, sweet, dark fruit, not as sour as Id like. Mouthfeel is thin, light carbonation. Overall, a little disappointing.

Pours a light purplish color with a thin tan ring. Aroma is somewhat faint with a tart fruitiness. Taste is semi-tart fruit but not as sour as the "Wild One" This is much smoother with a nice smoky earthy undertones surrounding the fruit. Very enjoyable but could have been a bit more sour or fruity to be better.
On tap at Bells on 8/7/15. Pours clear red with a thin off-white head. Malty nose with some butter and fruity sourness. Malt and butter flavor giving way to sour fruit before a creamy finish.

Draft @ CBC 2015. Pours a pale amber orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty weak floral aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty weak bretty flavor. Has a fruity spicy yeasty finish.

Pours mostly clear amber with a beige head. Aroma is a bit dirty from the Brett with light funk and sweet malts and tea. Flavor has the light tartness with some sweet tea as well on a lighter but full body for the style.
CBC. Hazy brown with off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, caramel, yeast, spices and a little toasted. Flavour is malt, fruit, caramel, yeast, toasted, wood, hop and medium sweet.
Draft. Pours a brownish amber color. Aroma and taste are tart with fruit, some caramel, and some sweetness.

On tap: The aroma consists of light caramel, cola, fruit, and a touch of toasted nuts. Its a mostly transparent dark orangish-brown with a small off-white head that eventually fades to a thin film outlined by a thick ring. There is some spotty lacing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts light caramel and cola flavors. There is some light sour cherry and toasted nuts in finish. Its light-medium bodied with light-moderate carbonation.
I respect this beer, but it's not really my cup of tea. Has tons of dark fruit, caramel, and Belgian like yeast notes.

Draft at fireworks Arlington. Pours golden with a thin white head. Doesn't leave much lacing. Has a bit of a fruity note on the nose. A bit of sweetness on the tongue. Finishes clean. Solid but not spectacular. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at Boulevardia 2015. Comes a somewhat cloudy reddish brown with a decent eggshell head. Aroma of malt, fruit, yeast, and spice. Taste is malt, caramel, fruit, berries, yeast, and spice. Different in a good way.

Multiple ~3 oz sample at the Boulevardia Taps & Tastes in Kansas City, Missouri. The pour is a slight haze copper brown with a small off white head. The aroma is dough, semi sweet caramel, nutty and a hint of roast/toast. The taste is very much the nose, a pleasant balance of the dough, nut and caramel malt along with a pleasant yeast floral herbal. Bit of the roast and toast in the finish. The palate is medium bodied, softer carbonation and the yeast floral roast finish. Different and fun beer.
Draught. This is a deep rich and tart BDG with a really well honed smokiness and refined nose.

Keg at the 4th Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Session 2, 01/05/2015.
Lightly hazed orange amber with a decent off white covering.
Nose is strawberry, tangy citric rind, berry fruit aroma, light spice.
Taste comprises strawberry jam, raspberry pips, lemon rind, damp hay, light spice, faint tropical vibes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: From tap at CBC 2015. Dark amber colour with an off-white head. Arom and flavour of malt, fruit, hops, yeast and spice.

Pours a reddish brown with medium khaki head. Aroma has cherries and kiwi, some roasted malts and a bit of smoke. I ordered this in a restaurant, not knowing what style it might be, only that I didnt like the sample of a beer named after a jazz organist, so I asked for the bass player instead. (Jimmy Smith made work tougher to find for bass players). Taste is fruity yet bitter, with some funky yeast. Body is medium with soft carbonation and an almost oily mouthfeel. I was looking for something different and unexpected and found it.

Healthy brown pour with a healthy red hue, half inch khaki head. Sweet aroma of kiwi. Sweet aroma of kiwi, light tart cherry, honeydew, deep sweet malt and lactose is barely detectable. Soft carbonation, mouthfeel slightly acidic and thin, tingly dry finish. Flavor of funky brett, accompanied by caramel/woodsy/light chocolate, a bit of tart cherry, grape, leather too. New favorite form Bells, what I would imagine wild one would taste like with some age on it.

Draught @ CBC 2015 [ Blue Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, Denmark [ As Bells Le Contrebassiste ].Clear medium amber orange color with a small to average, frothy to creamy, good to fair lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, tart, moderate yeasty, saison yeast, butterscotch. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average duration, caramel, yeasty - biere de garde - saison yeast - grain, tart notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150501]

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2015, Blue Session - fuzzy amber with white head. Sweet malty and fruity aroma and taste, caramel and some yeasty notes, grassy and floral.

Draft at Ei8ht Ball. Pours a cloudy, dull amber color with a small off-white head that eventually settles into a ring. Tons of funk throughout this, with earth, brown sugar, faint smoke, plum, flowers, mild spice, sweet malts, and slightly sour berries. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet, funky mouthfeel. Really unique.
CBC. Hazy amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and sour fruit. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. 010515

On tap at Ei8ht Ball in Cincy/Kentucky: copper pour with thin light tan head and minimal stick. aroma of faint vinegar tart, yeast, maybe a touch smokey. tastes are sweet caramel, nutty, roasty, smokey. clean, even. palate is little on weak side. good overall. grew on me. 7.4
[5/1/15] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015. 2nd session. Amber-brown. Aroma of caramel, oak, fruitiness, pedio. Sourish-sweetish flavor with caramel, fruits, oak. Medium-bodied.

Tap @CBC2015
Ruby-brown color, good creamy off-white head. Strawberry fruity aroma, a bit cellary. Medium-bodied. Soft fruity beer, strawberries, some cellar.

Draught sample at CBC 2015. Amber orange colour with a thin, off-white head. Fruity aroma with toasted malts, light smoke, bread, caramel malts and a yeasty note. Taste is lightly sweet. Medium body with a creamy texture. Finishes dry and fruity with gentle smoke and yeasty notes. Okay.

Draft to taster at Ei8ht Ball. Pours a slightly hazy amber brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet malts, apples and dark fruit, figs, a slight tart character, mild roast, a hint of smoked wood, light spices, interesting combination of flavors.

Draught @ CBC 2015, Blue Session, København
Pours hazy amnber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, tart, fruits, red berries and hint of vinegar. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter and light sour with a long fruity, funky, caramel and berry finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
Tap at CBC 2015, Copenhagen. Originally rated 20150501. Colour is clear brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Berries, sweetness and fruits.

Draught at CBC 2015, blue session, with Ken, Colin, Reuben and Alex. Golden/orange beer with a decent head. Fruity sourish aroma, grassy, perfume, hay, floral notes. Hoppy grassy flavor, sourish, hay, floral, some dough. Quite nice.

1st May 2015CBC Blue Session. Keg. Hazy amber beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry, mild fine carbonation. Mild gueuzey sourness offset by creamy sweetness. Light finish. Decent.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Blue session. Amber orange color with off-white head. Malty caramel aroma, light hoppy citrusy, light yeasty. Sweet and bitter and light acidic taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Draught at CBC 2015.
Clear orange coloured with a medium sized off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and bread.
Fruity flavour of caramel and bread.
Sweet finish.

From tap. Pours cloudy orange to brown with a small off white head. Aroma is toasted malty and breadish. Light caramelish. Sweet, fruity, toasted and slight caramelish. Bitter, fruity and slight toasted malty. Mellow and light fruity finish.
Draught at CBC2015. Clear brown - offwhite head.Marzipan. Fruity. Light acid. Wierd fruity. Cola fruity. Funky. Yeasty. Eastery. A bit wierd.

Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours hazy orange with a creamy offwhite head, lacings. Aroma of malt, yeast, light brett, caramel, wood, cherries. Flavor is light malt, yeast, little sour, wood, tart fruit, cherries. Medium body, lively carbonation, light acidic finish. 010515

Tap at The Oak. Cloudy amber pour with a small foamy head. Aroma is kinda fruity with some mild brett and flowers. Tastes boring but decent. Cherry skins, caramel, light brett. Mild tartness. Just not much going on with this one.
Tap @CBC15. Hazy dark amber, lasting offwhite head. Slightly bretty aroma. Fruity and malty flavour, fluffy mouthfeel.

On tap at the Tipsy Cow as one of Bells special releases for the second day of Madisons Craft Beer Week. Served as a large sampler, showing a clear, amber color, with a modest layer of light tan, head foam, and light spots & streaks of lacing. The nose was floral & fruit, with a hint of musty funkiness, soft malt, and a touch of caramel sweetness. Light to medium bodied, with appropriate carbonation, the taste was as the aroma notes, plus light tartness, subtle alcohol perception, and some dryness into the finish. Decent, mid-version of the style.

Sample at CBC 2015. 

Hazy reddish/amber with a small head. On the sweet side with cherries, light brett, fruit, toffee and some bread. A bit special but I kind of liked it.

Tap at CBC 2015. Pours hazy orange brown with a tan head. Aroma of light funk, Brett, tart dark fruits, red fruits and caramel. Flavour is light moderate sweet and sour . Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
At CBC. Poured deep orange amber with a tan head. Aroma of sweetly sour berries. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, moderately sour.
Tap @ CBC, 2015. Pours Amber copper with a fluffy head. Caramel, Brett and raspberries. Bready. Dry finish.
Tap at CBC15 copper... Thin tan lacing... Soft toffee fruit nose... Musty toffee fruit.. Light funk

Pours hazy copper with low off-white head. Aroma of bretta, cherries, almond icing, funk. Taste is sweetish and lightly boozy with liquored cherries and almond icing. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.
Draft pour at sheffields. Crazy dark red color with off white head. Tart, fruits, raisin, plum, and maybe licorice too. Very complex and unusual, but like it.
Nice fruity aroma. Nice amber red color. Sweet fruit up front. Interesting oaky flavors and yeast funk. Refreshing carbonation and slightly bitter finish.
Tap...real nice vinous nose followed by complex sweet-tart and slightly sour taste. Very easy drinking and delicious. I would have liked this a little more sour to balance the sweetness.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Sour fruity nose, faint caramel. Hazy bronze with a mostly lasting white head. Dry, somewhat fruity, funky. Light bodied.
Draft in C-ville. Deep hazy ruby amber color, tan head. Nice aroma of overripe plums, port wine. Taste is very fruity, tons of dark fruit, prunes, raisins. Very vinous. Delicious.
Good slightly citrusy biere de garde. Pours reddish amber with decent head and lacing. Tangy finish. Tap at Churchkey.
Draft at Parlor City. Pours murky brown with no real head. Nose and taste is some caramel. Taste adds some sourness. Okay.

Backlog rating on 11-08-2012 at Club Soda in Fort Wayne, IN. This draft beer has a small tan head that is mostly lasting, transparent reddish brown body, soft carbonation, and spotty amounts of lacing. The aroma is light roasted malt, yeasty and smoky. The flavor mimics the aroma. The mouthfeel is soft carbonation and this beer is medium bodied. A good quaffable Brown Ale with a good flavor, worth trying and a beer I would drink again.
Very interesting beer. Pours a nice chestnut brown. Aromas are funk, vegetation, and nuts. Lots of roasted malts smoke too. Good stuff.
On tap at Bells Brewery, pour was a reddish amber with a thin head. Aromas of fruity hops, vanilla, coffee, and slight smokyness.

On tap at Dans on January 24. The pour is thin, and brown. Its pretty translucent as far as browns go, but its not completely clear. No head to be found. The aroma is has some malts, some nuttiness to it, and a light note of caramel. The flavors mimic the aromas perfectly. The mouth feel is really thin, to be expected for a brown, and the after taste doesnt hang around. Not bad, but browns are a bit bland for me

Tap. Pig and fiddle. 12 oz tulip. Dark reddish brown, hazy, with nice creamy white head. Little aroma. Dark fruit sweet and sourness. A bit of fig flavor. Malty and tart at the same time. Nice, better than expected.
Pours reddish brown, smallish head, aroma is malt, as it warms smokey. Flavor is malty, dark fruit with smokiness at the end. Nice big mouthfeel. Really nice beer for cool weather.

Tap at Beer Study. I enjoyed this one a bit more than the other brewpub exclusive, Le pianiste, but only slightly more. Light smokey notes, more bread and caramel, some light wood and toasted grains. Okay, but nothing Id ever seek out.

pours a clear amber/ruby with a medium off white head. aroma has dark fruits and some earthy hops. flavor follows suit and adds layers of mild vanilla, caramel and coffee. Mouthfeel is full and the finish is slightly fruity and earthy/dry.

Pour on tap at APN 2013, reddish pour with thin off white head, aroma brought notes of caramel, smoke, hints of dark fruits, slight yeast, nice spice, dark nutty notes as well, slight hints of a earthy tone as well. Taste is a mix of earthy and spicy yeast, hints of nuts, spice, and smoke, lots of caramel, toffee and more yeast come through, finishing sweet, slightly dry.
Draft at Blue monk. Deep Brown pour with a creamy thin khaki head. nose is light and malty. Taste is a bit nutty, getting some dark fruit and the French yeast. Not spectacular, but enjoyable.

On tap at Bells Beer Social at Tap and Mallet. Quite excellent. They billed it as a Biere De Garde. Underrated. Funky and fruity nose. Reddish brown, slight haze. Smoky, caramel in palate, along with cherries and wood. Enjoyable, though it will be hard to come across it again.

Tap pour - comes murky brown with a tan head. Malty aroma with some bready yeast notes...splash of smoke (not dominant) and some tropical fruit - odd stuff, yet intriguing. Flavor is malty, bready, yeasty, spicy, slightly smoky and easy drinking - again, very different - wavered back and forth on this one and never came to a decision on whether I really liked it. Palate is medium bodied with light carbonation. Okay stuff overall, but probably the worst of the sampler I had this evening.

Tap sampler, Bells Eccentric Café, 31/viii/13. Dry caramel sugar and roast create a first layer of pancakes & coffee. Earthy yeast profile, creamy mf add the extra butterscotch and maple syrup on top of that. And yet this brown ale de garde has a light mf. Not bad, but unfocused: a double bass that is played in too many registers at once.

Draft at Rockwell/Republic pours a dirty brown. , slight roast aromas , medium body , nice light roast finish with mild sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at the Bells Eccentric Café, Kalamazoo, MI. 6.9%. 
Dark copper colour with a small off-white head.
Mild malt and sweetness in a very mild aroma. 
Sweet malt, mild hops and mild yeast in the flavour. 
Its a bit unclear to me what this is supposed to be.
On tap September 28, 2013 at ABR. Amber pour with malt, spice and smoke in the aroma and taste. Sounded like it would be good, but was one of the worst I tried at the event.
On tap at bells ec, smokey aroma with some malt. Really nice smoked carmel flavor!! Great!
Tap @ eccentric café. Pours a hazy brown color. Aroma of banana, caramel. Taste is tart caramel malt, pretty bland. Would not look to do this again.
Draft at Bells 28th birthday party at Renos East. Deep copper color. lots of malt and fruit flavor. Has a woody dirty flavor that lingers.
Draft at Bell's 28th birthday party at Reno's East. Deep copper with a beige head. Malty and apple. Barnyard/horse blanket funk and some mellow wood. Grows on you a bit.

Aroma: slightly smoky but not very aromatic. App: redish brown, thin whit head. Taste: decimate caramel flavors with a smokey aftertaste. Chocolate in the end but coffee seems lost. Palate: full but short finish. Overall: very enjoyable.
Can definately pick out the roast and smoked flavor as well as smell. Fairly dark with medium head. Tasted like chocolate to me. Could be the french ale yeast. Found it quite delcious.

4oz pour at Churchkeys Bells event during DC Beer Week 2013. Pours a hazy garnet amber with some creamy, off white head. Nose of caramel, little nutty, brown malt, bread. Flavor is malty, light candy, dried apple, nuts, some mild chocolate. Chalky, sweet finish. Decent enough.

Draft at Churchkey for a Bells tap takeover event. Poured a slighty hazy amber color with a medium sized white head. aroma was some light caramel, earthy notes. Smoke. Flavor was chewy malts, some earthy notes, spices.
Sample at APN. Pour is a cloudy red/amber, tons of off-white head. Yeasty, but good.
Sampled at All Pints North 2013 in Duluth, aroma of some nutty malt and caramel, taste similar bit watered down
Tap at All Pints North 2013. Murky amber pour with a frothy cream head. Smoked malts. Some yeast. Pretty solid.

Draft sample. Dark brown in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are muted, but have elements of dark toasted malts, and a bit of fruit. Flavors are a bit more intense, with rich pale malts, faint woodsmoke, caramel all working together. A bit of mild roast/chocolate on the back end too. A bit too mellow for me, but still drinkable.

Plastic taster on tap at Party Town. Clear brown color. Thin khaki head. Good row of lace. Nice chocolatey, kind of nutty aroma. Medium-plus body. Lighter carbonation. Lightly dry finish. Good mild sweet taste. Nice, robust biere de garde... First of the three I tried one after another, but this ended up being my favorite of the series
Malty, but balanced bitterness. Really nice rich mouthfeel. Not super interesting, but a definite delicious factor.
Draught at Bells. Dark amber color. Farm aromas. Smooth semi sweet nutty brown.

On tap at Bell's 3/31/13. Not too much in the aroma. Reddish brown pour. Nutty taste. No lacing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft.  Chocolate barley malt aroma.   Dark amber with small head.   Chocolate malt flavor.  Moderate alcoholic finish.  Very different.

Draft to taster at the Eccentric Cafe. Looks solid; a transparent copper with thin light beige lacing. Smells semi-sweet, yeasty, and a little doughy. Tastes like it smells with a hint of chocolate. Average on the palate. Decent, but forgettable.

Most balanced of the biere de garde trio. Slightly sweet; slightly spicy; nice malt base. Very saison like as well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at trion pours a hazy copper with a thin head. Fruit and citrus aroma. A fruit malt taste.
Draft at Trion. Fruity, smoky caramel malt aroma. Deep amber with a small ivory head. Sweet fruity caramel malt flavor with a light smoky character.  Medium body, soft carbonation.

This draft brew from a restaurant poured a small sized head of foamy finely sized off-white colored bubbles that were quickly diminishing and left behind a softly carbonated transparent red brown colored body. The mild aroma was malty. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish. The tasty flavor contained notes of mild hops caramel and malt. A decent one that I would consider buying again.

On tap at the Shark Club in Howell, MI. Poured an amber color with a small sized off white head. Buttered popcorn - could not get past the popcorn aroma and tastes. Maybe some caramel and nuttiness. Between the drummer and piano I had with this tonight, this was a distant 3rd.
Tap. Mahogany with small head. Slightly funky brune. Smooth with light malt. Hint of nuts.

Draft. Poured a clear dark brown color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate toasted smoked malt aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Solid balanced toasted sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. Good complex brew.

Draft at Maduro pre-GTMW,  Murky, chunky brown-orange.  Steady beige head.  Chewy yeast tones.  Mellow, odd play-dough flavor.  Pretty unique, though the smoke and biere de garde action sort of cancel each other out in a messy way.  Fruity, some hoppy amber malt notes.  I liked it on the first sip, but really isnt growing on me.  Unique, but not a world class brew.

Poured a clear dark orange-brown. The head was tan with good retention and lacing. Whiffs of brown sugar, pecan, and milk chocolate on a bed of hay. Light to medium bodied and delicately sweet with mild bitterness. Date, roasted nuts, and brown sugar flavors. Very grain/earthy at the end.

7/28/11 contrebassiste @ pap.
Murky orange tinted brown w/a small pale tanhead.
A banana, bs, ,booze, nuts,
Coffeee, really yeasty.

F coffee-nuttiness, a bit sweet,choco, lots of yeast.

Full body, sludgey, meh 7/4/6/2.5/13

On draught at Fourth Street Bar & Grill during the Bells Tap Takeover on 10/12/2011: Pours a murky amber-brown color with a medium white head that diminishes steadily to an outer ring. Thin rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of peaty, smokey malt and ripe fruit. Medium creamy body with flavors of earthy malt, fruit and nuts. The finish is figgy and malty with a faint smokey aftertaste. Above average overall.

Number three (of three) in the French Jazz series - The Bruin

Serving glass: Poured from tap into small goblet.

Appearance: Rich, hazy mahogany with off-white head.

Aroma: Plum, toffee, slightly smoky.

Taste: Smoky, sweet caramel and toffee. Some dark fruit and cherry. With the yeast (while present) pushed mostly to the background, this seems more like a Scotch Ale.

Palate: Moderate carbonation, full body, smooth but just a touch cloying.

Overall: The strongest in alcohol and flavor of the three Biere de Gardes, but the slightly cloying body means that I prefer Le Pianiste. Still quite good.

Very cloudy brown pour small bubbled tan head 4
Light smoky almost salty butter & pecan sweet caramel 7
Avg pal 3
Nice subtle smoke taste almost like salty meat light chocolate finishes caramel well mellowed 8
I enjoyed 15

At cincinnatis brew haha event of all places. 
Pours a reddish brown thin off white. 
Sweet. Wild cheese yeasty aroma. 
Mildly sweet. 
Finish is slightly sweet and  tart. Oily texture.

Draft sample - pours opaque brown with tan head. Aroma is smoky and a lot like the smell of the liner notes of a new cassette tape. Taste is sweet. Aftertaste is long and a tiny bit bitter. OK but not memorable.
An easy drinking brown with a coco powder finish. really quite nice. Pretty straightfoward but with an odd aroma i can;t put my finger on.

On tap (guest)

After starting with a disappointing pour of Black Note I moved on to a couple of new beers. This one was decent for the style and much easier to finish than the previous beer. As this has been on almost every year I would expect it to reappear again at next years Maduro event.

Aroma / Appearance - The hazy body was the color of an espresso milkshake topped by shavings from a plank of maple. Long spindly legs creep down the sides. The smell of musty redwood floors coupled with a sweet texture. Topped by maple and cherry fruit filling from a vending machine it harmonizes well.

Flavor / Palate - Maple, Twix, and nutty touches flow across the palate. The chewy mouthfeel leaves a dry warm finish. Heady after a half pint I decided to move on to the next beer only to save the palate. The Friday before the Great Taste is about pacing yourself not racing to the finish line by 3 PM.

On tap at Maduro.  Poured cloudy medium amber with a short cap of khaki head.  The aroma picked up warm fruit, molasses, and maple with touches of rye and vanilla around.. warm and welcoming.  The flavor found molasses and drawn caramel with some chocolate laced throughout.. dry, earthy bitterness as well.. nice balance, but not greatly enjoyable.  Medium-bodied and dry on the palate.. a tad grainy.. just OK feel and flow.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a deep brown colored body with a finger-width, dense and creamy, light tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma has a nice nutty sweetness with a light toast, some caramel and toffee, a light earth, a bit bready, and a few yeasty fruits. Flavor is similar. Nutty and slightly bready up front with a hint of toast and a light fruity element. A touch of earth towards the end before this finishes nutty and smooth with a light fruit and hint of toast that dries with a bit of chocolate creeping in there. Medium length aftertaste following a smooth, medium body and a moderate carbonation. Overall, a pretty nice beer. Pleasant, richer nutty and toffee flavor with a touch of earth and toast along with a decent fruity yeast element. Nothing crazy, but enjoyable.

Draft on tap at Maduro Bells Event (Madison, WI). Pours a murky deeper brownish amber pour, with good haze and murk with a darkness to it. A frothy offwhite head laces small, rings a bit. Aromas are a nice yeasty feel, dry and spicy with darker carmelized malts, a touch of smoke, bread, pale malts, and dough. A bit spicy and dry. Initial is medium bodied with spice, dry hops. Soap, caramel, toffee, bread dough. Some darker malts, toast, and earth. Backend throws some carmelization, smoke, dry hops, touch of yeast. Nice but strange beer. Smokiness up front grows a bit more. Nice, but probably not a beer Id redo or drink much of.
I think this one is super fruity and sweet. I didnt get as much of the roasted character.

Served on draft at Maduro in Madison, WI at the GTMW pre-party. Pours a hazy dark amber with a large creamy head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of caramel, toffee, earthy notes, banana and a faint bit of smoke. The taste is toffee, spice, earth and smoke. Medium bodied. Quite nice.

tap at the eccentric cafe. murky, swampy brown with no head. not appealing in this aspect. aroma of burnt sugar, fig, spice, and clove. flavor of viscous sugars, big clove, candied banana and fig. overly sweet and a touch syrupy.

Reddis brown pour with small off white head. Aroma is fruity with caramel and cotton candy. Nice creamy mouthfeel and just the right carbonation on this sweet beer. Taste is very sweet with caramel and malt dominating, slightly nutty background. Very enjoyable.

On tap at Bells. Aroma: MOstly peaches, light cherry and pear. Really fruity some alcohol vapors. Appearance: Murky brown, thin head. Taste: Sweet, fruity (tropical fruits). Palate: Medium carbonation, sweet and sticky palate. Not so good. Overall: Too sweet but still OK. Didnt feel like a brown ale but mostly like a sweet tripel.

On tap; pour is murky dark brown/amber with a mild off white head that dissapears. Fruity, bready nose, caramel. On the tongue, you can sense that it shares character with the others, but the roasty/smoked malts add a sense of depth, yet they are hardly present in this brew. The bitterness is still present, and it is sweeter than the others. Anyway, I enjoyed this one the most

Pours a very hazy reddish brown color with a small head. The aroma is fruity and nutty with some fig and apple character, The flavor follows with the nutty on fruity thing again. The beer is lightly spicy with a nice mild bitterness all around. Toasty and bold tasting this beer has some fig and apple rind notes with a mild chocolate character rounding it out. The beer is not terribly dry and the booze is certainly noticeable, but its miles from cloying and boozy. 
Its almost like a quad blended with a brown ale, pretty nice stuff really.

On tap at Eccentric Café.  Murky fruitwood with next to no head.  Aroma is mildly funky with toasted malt, yeast nuts and a touch of caramel.  Taste is nutty with light yeast, toasted malt and light funk.

On tap at Bells last weekend.

Pours a mostly-clear brown-amber color with a short white head. Some spotty lacing as it goes down. The nose is pretty tame, bringing just a bit of malt and bread crust. The flavor is more complex and fits the style quite well, bringing some nice earthy elements and a slight fruity touch. Bread is the main characteristic. Some sweetness. Medium body and moderate carbonation. A good example of a style Im not particularly fond of.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 06-28-2011

On tap at the cafe a few weeks ago. Considering brown ales arent my thing, I was surprised by how enjoyable this was. It definitely had a nutty earthy thing going on and with a little but not too much malty sweetness, it was pretty tasty. It didnt look like much in my sample glass, but I was impressed nonetheless. The 7+% makes it a nice sipper. If they bottled it for the fall season I would probably grab a couple, but it looks like they only have it on tap. Good thing Kalamazoo isnt too far away for me.
On tap. Light and dirty brown body with little head and aromas of damp soil, autumn leaf pile and toffee. Flavor is earthy with a little nut and a hint of funk.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: (Draught)  Pours a clear amber body with a medium cream head.  Aroma of toasted grain, nuts, subtle smoke, grass, and maple.  Flavor of toast grain, biere de garde yeast, grass, caramel, and light smoke.
Copper colored appearance, thin tan head.  Rich maltly aroma with some dark fruit.  Wild flavors!  Tastes like a Belgian Strong Ale minus the yeast character.  Intersting beer.

Rich malty nose... lots of raisins, plums, some toffee and a touch of fresh flowers. Taste is light to moderately sweet, light bitterness, with lots of toffee, a shot load of plums and raisins. Malty delight.

GABF 2010.  Pours a deep coppery amber brown with a thinning head.  Aroma is dull peppery phenolics, earth, toast, nutty brown malts, slight burnt hints, and a touch of smoke with grass.  Flavor is toast, munich malts, caramel, malty lager like fairly clean in the end with some earth, leather and grass, hints of smoke and phenol.  Ok.
I would call this a bier de garde.  Malt aroma with light smoke.  French yeast, and a good, medium palate.

Sampled from the tap at the 2010 MBG Fall Fest. Poured a cloudy amber brown with yellow brown head that dissipated to the edges. Aroma had a nice light fruit note with some citrus and a bit of pine coming in. Flavor had some more pine with light grains, fruit and floral notes. There was also a strong presence of roasted/smoked malts. A complex, but well rounded beer.

Draft at Autumn Brew Review. Pours a clear reddish mahagony color with a slight white head. Very malty and biscuity in the nose. Smells sweet. The taste is, as I smelled, sweet up front with a long drawn out biscuity and sweet taste. Minimal hop presence. A big and rich beer. Medium mouthfeel. Didnt pick up any alcohol type notes. Not too bad.

sample from the pitcher @ GABF on 9/17/10.  see through light brown pour.  sweet nose with some nuts.  light to medium body with more nuts and sweet malts.  sweet finish with raisin and grape notes.  somewhat bland.
GABF 2010, did not really come off like brown. light amber, lighter aroma of toasted malts. sweet malts flavor with a wisp of smoke. ok

Sampled at GABF!  Chestnut colored pour with a small eggshell head.  Nutty, caramel laden aroma with a bit of dark fruit.  Honey, biscuit, roasted malt, and nuts in the flavor.  Medium mouthfeel.  Not great as expected from the brewer but not bad.

Sampled at GABF on 9/16/2010. This brown ale pours a medium orange gold color. Medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is malty, caramel, bready and nutty. A medium bodied brown ale. The malts are fruity, bready and sweet.  The hops are herbal. Nice carbonation. Good balance. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

Tap at Bells City TAP House event PBW10. Pours a brownish amber with a medium off white head.  Aroma of caramel, toffee, toasted malt and light smoke.  Flavor of teh same, some chocolate poking through.

[Draft @ City Tap House] Brown amber color with a small, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of caramel, toasted malts, nuts, roast, and earthy yeast.  Taste of nuts, caramel, burnt toffee, and a semi-sweet finish.

Served on tap at City Tap House.

Pours a deep dark amber copper color with dark goldn mahogany edges when held to a light source and a one finger frothy off-white head that slowly settles into a lasting ring. Minimal spots of lacng oft behind.

Slightly roasty sweet malt aroma with a faint touch of smokiness. Hintsnof bready yeast, chocolate, caramel and toffee. Overall though the nose is pretty bland.

Mediumbidied with a prominent roasty smoked flavor up front with hints of acrid burnt malt and toast which are quickly mellowed out by sweet notes of hazelnut, toffee, milk chocolate and caramel. A bit too carbonated for my loony but this beer improves with warmth, becoming more smooth and balanced with a slightly creamy lactic presence. Probably the most complex Biere de Garde Ive had.

This poured a medium brown color with an off white head. Aroma was brown malt, light smoke and toasted character. Flavor was light caramel, yeasty character, light fruits, and light roasted notes. A decent brown.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2010 On tap at the Eccentric Cafe. Deep, hazy orange-brown body, thin-medium dense buff head. Light nose, with sweet brown sugar, toast, and clove. Roasty body with clove and banana, dry, toasty, leathery and salty, rather thin. This beer had a chocolaty roasted character that is also notable in some of the brewers lighter specialty stouts (Trumpeters Stout, Milk Stout). Pretty good.

On tap 4/19/10. Another of the Jazz series."a French inspired Brown ale". Pours a dark reddish brown with a thin ring of head.Not much of an aroma other than the light mellow tea scent. Flavor ids the same with some distant fruit, light cola, and general plain-ness.A little earthy with some dirt and tobacco. Not bad.
